column1: back of a length, Roy prods and gets a thick inside edge past his stumps for a couple to fine leg as they come haring back
short, 135kph and veering down the leg side
length, rising to hit the splice as Roy presses on to the front foot
banged in short and Roy swivels on a pull to the man at deep square leg
slightly wayward again, dragged down and there's room for Hales to swing his arms at his first ball and clock it through the covers, Warner giving chase to prevent four
dug in, 135kph and climbing through as Roy comes down and bails out of an attempted pull
shortish, big swing and a miss from Roy - too close to the tramlines, though
back of a length, Roy latches on and cracks the ball through midwicket, beats the man on the ring and it races away for the first boundary of the day
length outside off, rising up as Hales stabs it towards point

Hales smashes the ball into the air, it's high but overs Finch at mid-on... oh, taken at the second attempt on the run! Stanlake strikes second ball thanks to an excellent catch over his shoulder by Finch. Hales, playing his 50th T20I, fails in an attempt to assert himself early
length, 148kph outside off, dabbed to third man on the back foot
hits the pitch hard, Stanlake pushing the gun up to 148kph again, Malan tries to pull his first ball and splices short of midwicket
oof, that has ripped through, touching 150kph/93mph and decking away as Malan feels for it and is beaten
banged in very short, all height and no trousers this time, not troubling the batsman
fired in full and Malan gets a chunk of bat in it, mid-on cuts it off as they scuttle through
short of a length and tucked off the hip for one

slightly short, Roy hangs back and tries to guides to third man - but nicks it to the keeper instead! Richardson strikes now, bit of a freebie as Roy got a bit casual rather than going hard, scraped the toe of the bat through to Carey. England two down early
pitched up in the channel and Vince strokes one to the cover sweeper to get going
short ball, 133kph and swivel-jabbed for one through midwicket
short and wide and slashed between slip and gully for four! Saw a few of those during the Tests, but there's not so much protection here and Vince picks up a first boundary

and again, Carey only able to get fingertips on it! This was closer to him as he tried to cut, flew off the top edge but the keeper couldn't quite grab it despite an impressive dive. Slip had gone wider, too
short of a length, Malan goes to pull
pitched up, 148kph and Malan pings it off his toes through midwicket for a couple
back of a length, worked off the hip
in the channel, 145kph and worked into the leg side as Vince moves across
short, 140kph and ramped over gully for four! Nicely played, using Stanlake's pace and it bounces to the rope

tip and run, but there's a direct hit from mid-off! Malan is short! Brilliant work from Warner, collecting low down and releasing a right-arm rocket in one fluid movement - both feet in the air as he lets go - and Malan just keeps on running! He knew he was in trouble but it still required a lightning pick up and release to catch him short of his ground
shortish and defended coming across
ooh, beats the outside edge, 133kph and a bit of nibble as Buttler feels for it
length, tapped downs square

oh, my word, almost another run-out! Buttler didn't do his partner any favours here, 'Yes... No!' the call as he pushed towards cover and Maxwell had time to line up the throw but missed with Vince well out of his ground
comes across and pats the ball down square, Vince is more assertive this time and calls them through, the underarm from point misses anyway
length around off and Vince taps another single into the off side
length ball, angling in and worked away off the hip
short, 127kph and Buttler gets in a bit of a tangle trying to pull, loops off the toe but into the gap between mid-on and midwicket
comes across and defends
dug in short, Buttler pulls and the ball flies off the top edge, but he gets it fine of deep backward square leg! Almost went all the way, in the end - bit streaky though
pitched up and punched towards mid-on
fullish outside off and Buttler drills the ball to mid-off, this time Warner goes for the non-striker's end but Vince looked to be home safely
short ball, whipped off the hip and into a gap at deep square for a couple
angled in on the stumps and worked away

panic at the disco... but Tye drops the ball trying to run out Buttler! Vince's pull picked out midwicket but Buttler had gone racing down,Finch's throw bounced up and Tye looked to have it in his hands but let go just as he was breaking the stumps. Would have been tight, Buttler maybe got his bat back
slower ball in the channel, swing and a miss
slashed wide of the keeper! Thick outside edge on the drive from Vince, single to third man
full on off, Buttler crunches a drive wide of mid-off for a few
tossed up nicely on off and Buttler prods it away towards extra cover
darted in much quicker and Buttler forces it away through cover point to bring up the England 50
fired quick, 100kph and leg side, hits the pads
tossed up and Vince mistimes a push back to the bowler
angled flat on the stumps, quick and straight again, Vince steps down and tickles one to midwicket
nicely placed by Buttler, working against minimal turn and he nudges square off his pads for a couple
length, 133kph outside off, dabbed down to third man
angled in with the arm and tucked into the leg side
taking the pace off, short and Vince cloths a pull towards midwicket, lands short but there's no time to steal a run
another cutter, 110kph and Vince waits on it, dabs square
full on off, Buttler had dummied a shimmy to leg and instead just stays still and crunches a drive past extra cover for four
fired in full on the stumps and clipped through midwicket
darted in on the pads and worked to short fine leg for a quick single
looped up and Vince comes down, whips a single through the leg side
bit of flight, tossed up on off and tapped into the covers where Agar chases it down
floated up on middle and leg, Buttler works it through mid-on for one more
flat on leg stump, Vince clips it away square to the sweeper
fired into the pitch, short but skipping on as Buttler forces it away through midwicket, just a single again
legcutter outside off, bottom-edged into the leg side as Vince comes down
steered through cover point
banged in short and slightly leg side
short, 125kph and Buttler jumps into a swivel-pull to deep square leg

bowled 'im! Vince suckered by the slower ball! Loopy, seductive knuckleball from Tye but Vince never picked it, backing away to try and lash through cover, the ball dips to hit off and send him on his way
full speed, good length and punched square, terrific bit of fielding from Maxwell at point prevents one
fullish on off, comes down and again can't get the ball away
length outside off and Buttler can't get it away
full in the channel, driven past extra cover but Warner races from mid-off to intercept
squeezes down on the ball and gets a single through backward point
length, 145kph/90mph and sizzling into the gloves as Billing dances down and fails to connect with a push drive
fired in straighter, 142kph and hitting the splice as Billings defends
touch full and leg side but Billings neat clip goes straight to deep midwicket for a single
pitched up on middle and off, Billing steps out and whips to midwicket
short of a length on off, 132kph and Billings fails to connect with a pull - not fair from nicking through to Carey, either
shortish and tucked off the hip
full, cross seam but wobbly a touch as Buttler drives but picks out extra cover
full, punched down the ground to long-off
backs away to drive but Stoinis follows him and he can't pierce the infield
fired in leg side and worked for one
touch slower and loopier, chipped through midwicket playing back
fired in on the stumps and Buttler happy to keep ticking through the leg side
here he comes, gets to the pitch and slams the ball into the seats behind the sightscreen! Sweet as a nut straight down the ground, Billings finds a gear
pushed through flatter and Billing nurdles to leg
pushed through, quick on the stumps and Buttler can't get it away
Billings comes down early but Stoinis sees him and fires the ball full and wide, beats the aggressive swipe
short ball, pulled towards mid-on, this is a suicidal run... but Maxwell misses with one-and-a-bit stumps to aim at! Billings had given up on it
pre-meditates the ramp, moving across outside off, Stoinis takes the pace off and Buttler doesn't connect as he attempts to re-adjust
slower-ball bouncer, cutting his fingers over it and the ball loops past Buttler's attempted swat but foxes Carey too and they scamper a couple of byes
full outside off and Buttler piston-smashes a wristy square drive for one to the sweeper

Billings goes across to scoop... and loops a catch to the keeper! Or does he? The finger goes up but Billings asks for a review, although he doesn't look totally confident. Did it hit the glove, or even the bat face? No, just came straight off the thigh pad, so the decision is overturned, but it's still a dot ball for Stoinis to finish a tidy allocation
lobbed up and nudged off the pads for one
shuffles across and sweeps from right in front of leg stump, gets it fine for a rare boundary
fired in on middle and leg, squirted to short fine leg and they hustle the single
dragged down but the ball is quick and Buttler can only chop it into the turf
angled in on the stumps and flicked through the leg side
floated up and Billings it hit on the pads coming down, Agar chases after it to prevent a leg bye
slower outside off and mistimed through point
out the front of the hand but this swerves outside the tramlines
short and reverse-hoicked over gully, almost goes all the way! Coming forwards, ambitious shot, maybe expecting the slower ball but it flew off the top edge for a one-bounce four
comes forward and drills down the ground
goes short and Buttler can't get it away, swatted down into the off side
back of a length and pulled, gets a couple towards deep backward square leg
another knuckleball goes wrong as Buttler charges out
slower delivery, Buttler is sets for the reverse-pan handle over backward point... but completely fails to connect
length outside off, Billings makes room and rifles a drive past cover into the unguarded part of the ground
short and clubbed down the ground now, clears mid-on and it races away for four more

gone - slugged into the air and Warner takes it at mid-off! Billings' brief flurry is dealt with, Stanlake is a hard man to hit down the ground often, this was just too quick and his cross-batted mow lobbed up off the top edge
edged past the leaping Carey for four! Only his third boundary, gets a bit lucky but it flew beyond the fingertips
moves across looking for the ramp, fired leg side
again Buttler is low and into position for the leg-side scoop, can't connect and I think it flicked the pad on the way through to Carey, so no wide this time
length, 142kph and heaved into the leg side, won't get to the rope and it lands safely between two boundary riders for a couple more
angled across and Willey dabs it behind point
fires in the yorker, 137 kays on middle and leg, Buttler was standing on off stump and did well to dig it out down the ground for one
up periscope! Short and taking the pace off, loopy bumper on leg stump and Willey delicately taps it wide of Carey for four
full and straight and edged into the pads swinging hard to leg
floated up and flipped into the deep midwicket area for one
full outside off, 117kph as Buttler sweeps, down on one knee looking to manufacture something, gets a couple wide of fine leg
short, Willey swings hard, top-edges four over the keeper! Been England's most productive shot, that
got him, top-edged into the covers! Richardson took the pace off and Willey's big heave only succeeds in giving him the heave ho... Warner again calmly underneath to complete the dismissal
short, Buttler hammers a pull towards deep midwicket, they come racing back and he dives to make sure of two
Buttler backs off, Richardson spears the ball in full towards the blockhole, he can only dig out one down the ground
full, slower at 117kph and Jordan can only whack one through cover

pitched up, slogged down the ground... and Agar snags it on the run! Another excellent catch, Australia have been good in the field again, Buttler falls from the last ball looking for a boundary to finish a luke-warm effort. Seemed like he might have got hold of it, a flat, straight hit but taken smartly racing across to his left
good start, short of a length outside off with a hint of swing and Warner is prodding away from his body without any footwork
just over midwicket! Short of a length, a short-arm whip/pull, a shot that has caused him a few problems, and it narrowly evades the fielder
good length at off stump, defended
edged, taken! Warner's woes continue. Top bowling from Willey, pushes it up outside off, late swing, Warner pushing hard without footwork and it's a healthy nick to Buttler
almost through him like Hobart! Lynn staying on leg stump, there's some swing back on a good length, takes the back leg towards slip
slashed away, full outside off, gives himself some room and carved over point
over the wicket, good length at off stump, pushed into the covers
too short, Lynn goes up and over the off side, well clear of the in field and carries a long way towards the rope
fuller, outside off, a big swing and a miss as he aims down the ground
and this time he hammers a slower ball square through the off side, just waited a fraction longer
all the way, down the ground! Lynn doing what he talked about in that interview, plundering the ball straight down the ground. Full, in the slot, through the line
nearly picks out deep square leg! A big full toss, swung high into the leg side and Billings can't quite reach it
round the wicket, gets it wrong, speared full down the leg side, and also evades a diving Buttler
this is straighter, fired in at the pads, deflects to the off side
back over the wicket to Short, full at the stumps, takes him on the back pad...perhaps inside edge, sliding down leg
swings to the leg side against a length delivery and only finds fresh air, not far from being bowled
nicely bowled, full outside off with some swing, beats Short as he drives away from his body
beats him again, slightly shorter this time, late movement to take it past the outside edge
back of a length at off stump, defended to point
full outside off, driven powerful into the covers, there's a hand on the ball to take the pace off it
down the leg side, poor line
just a hint of width outside off and that's some power from Short, cracks it behind point with a thunderous square drive
fuller and straighter, at the stumps, tucked into midwicket...certainly no run rate pressure for Australia
a short ball, 141kph, Lynn goes for the pull and it scoots over the top edge
double-bluff, field set for the short ball and he pulls out a yorker, outside leg stump, than Lynn jabs out by his feet
he's timed that wonderfully, a full delivery outside off, gets a stride forward and places it between cover and mid-off
round the wicket, a short delivery, Lynn is across the crease trying to pull through square leg but doesn't make contact
full, outside leg stump, scoots between Lynn's legs to Buttler
and now another short one, Lynn is well outside leg and attempted a leg-side heave without contact
low full toss at the pads, he stands still this time and effortlessly flicks this over fine leg for six. Great wrists
full at the pads, misses the pad as Lynn as a mighty swing and deflects to the off side
full at off stump, dug out back to the bowler
pumped over the leg side! A crunched off the middle of the bat...poor delivery, a low full toss angled in at leg stump, Lynn's bat sweep is immense as he flicks it over mid-on
responds with the slower ball, Lynn is through his shot and gets an inside edge into his pads

and he gets him! The short ball does the trick in the end, Lynn aiming over the leg side, gets a big top edge which Buttler steadies himself underneath. But he's done significant damage in a small chase
a slower ball at the pads, brings an appeal lbw, surely pitched outside leg...they opt against the review
short of a length, tucked into the leg side
back of a length at off stump, 139kph, defended to the covers
full outside off, driven to long-off
full and straight, defended on the front foot
whipped from off stump through midwicket
short of a length outside off, Short works it behind square on the leg side
gives himself some room outside leg, drives into the covers without much timing
tries to work this with the spin but gets taken on the pads. Tidy start from Rashid
round the wicket, touch short to start with, driven off the back foot to deep cover
over the wicket, again a little short, driven down to long-on
well bowled, this is fuller and nearly does Maxwell for length as he plays back
he's forward this time and pushes a length delivery to the leg side
sweeps a good length delivery well in front of square
plays with the turn from outside off, through square leg, they look for a second, there's a fumble but in the end decide against it
short outside off, picks out cover
more air, fuller and straight, flicked to deep midwicket
brings out the reverse sweep, the ball is outside off, picks out short third man
moves outside leg stump to open the off side, carves it through the covers but the sweeper can get across
the googly, not sure he read that one, gets an inside edge to short fine leg
gets this reverse sweep away, over the men at backward point and short third man, but doesn't have the legs to reach the rope as deep point scurries around
throws his hands through a crunching drive down the ground, delivery was a touch wider outside off, sent it perfectly between long-on and long-off
and this time he clears all the fielders...this is fuller, it's a skimming drive over long-on
this time it's placed neatly through the covers off the back foot...very neat batting
worked into the leg side
length outside off, cracked to cover
and now Maxwell finds the crowd...stand-and-deliver blow over long-on, stayed in his crease, that's a massive over
turned into the leg side
another reverse, to a back-of-a-length ball, gets it find of short third man...placement perfect
blasted down the ground, a fierce straight drive which splits the deep fielders. He's not hanging around
over long-on! This isn't going to last long...stays in his crease this time, it's a full delivery, times it over the fence
a touch more of a heave about this one, gets it through midwicket but the placement is good again
held back a fraction outside off, driven to the cover sweeper
a straight full toss is knocked through the leg side
back of a length at middle and leg, worked off his hip to long leg
a short ball over off stump, Maxwell tries to ramp it over the keeper
a slower ball dragged down the leg side
takes a short-of-a-length ball into square leg and it's placed perfectly for the second
big full toss, follows Maxwell, pushed to deep midwicket...just okay for height
poor ball, full outside leg, but only costs a single as it's clipped straight to long leg
square driven to deep point
full and straight, swung down to long-on
angled into backward point
appeal for a catch down the leg side and Buttler calls for the review...looks like it's clipped pad on the first replay. Hot Spot confirms that
worked off the stumps to deep square leg
pushed down the leg side, neat take but that's a wide
full toss, fired in quickly, says 118kph! Whipped to long-on
and he gets Maxwell...short of a length, a slower delivery, goes for a big mow over the leg side, like Lynn gets a big top edge and it's a simple catch
full outside leg stump, deflects off the pad to Buttler
a shorter delivery, 107kph, rolls his wrists and pulls to deep square leg
short of a length, angled into the pads, goes for a pull but it takes the thigh pad
short again, down the leg side, this time Finch catches it up with it and sends it very fine...actually glove rather than bat
full outside off, heaved through the leg side wide of mid-on...nowhere nearly cleanly timed, but's a solid thick inside edge which runs away
over the wicket, worked off the pads to short fine leg
that's a monster down the ground...gets right underneath a full delivery and swings it into the first tier. That would do well on the golf course
back to back sixes to win it! Width outside off, carved high over third man...Finch finishes it on his home ground
